sections.heading: Short Title.Section 333.26402 - “Human Cloning” Defined
sections.text: Section 333.26403 - Human Cloning; Prohibited Conduct.Section 333.26404 - Exception.Section 333.26405 - Private Right of Action.Section 333.26406 - Violation; Penalty.

sections.heading: “Human Cloning” Defined.
sections.text:
As used in this act, "human cloning" means that term as defined in section 16274 of the public health code, 1978 PA 368, MCL 333.16274.

History:1998, Act 111, Eff. Mar. 23, 1999

sections.heading: Human Cloning; Prohibited Conduct.
sections.text:
A person shall not use state funds to engage in or attempt to engage in human cloning.

History:1998, Act 111, Eff. Mar. 23, 1999

sections.heading: Exception.
sections.text:
Section 3 does not prohibit the use of state funds for scientific research or cell-based therapies not specifically prohibited by that section.

History:1998, Act 111, Eff. Mar. 23, 1999

sections.heading: Private Right of Action.
sections.text:
This act does not give a person a private right of action.

History:1998, Act 111, Eff. Mar. 23, 1999

sections.heading: Violation; Penalty.
sections.text:
A person who violates section 3 is subject to a civil fine of $10,000,000.00. A civil fine imposed under this section shall be distributed in the same manner in which penal fines are distributed in this state.

History:1998, Act 111, Eff. Mar. 23, 1999
